docs.lead_paragraph: Although there is no way of knowing to what extent prescription drugs and a weight-loss diet may have affected the mental state of Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens, doctors have long been concerned about the emotional and physical hazards of both therapies. The Borough President's lawyer, Michael Armstrong, said yesterday that Mr. Manes had been taking two drugs, which he did not name, to control his high blood pressure. One drug was a beta blocker, the other a calcium channel blocker, Mr. Armstrong said.

headline.main: DRUGS MANES TOOK MAY HAVE EMOTIONAL EFFECTS

docs.snippet: Although there is no way of knowing to what extent prescription drugs and a weight-loss diet may have affected the mental state of Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens, doctors have long been concerned about the emotional and physical hazards...
